intro: Erythrococca, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red, fleshy fruits that resemble small, round berries. The plant features opposite, simple leaves and produces small white or yellowish flowers. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitats. However, it is important to note that some species within this genus may have medicinal or toxic properties.
